results.title: Asymmetric super-Heston-rough volatility model with Zumbach effect as scaling limit of quadratic Hawkes processes
results.summary: This paper explores Hawkes processes to model rough volatility in asset prices, leading to the super-Heston-rough model. It also shows how Time-reversal asymmetry can be modeled using Quadratic Hawkes processes.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper directly and substantially focuses on "Hawkes processes," which are a fundamental type of point process.

results.title: Explainable AI in Deep Learning-Based Prediction of Solar Storms
results.summary: This paper presents an approach to make a deep learning-based solar storm prediction model interpretable. The model, built on an LSTM network, aims to explain predictions for solar flares and coronal mass ejections.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper deals with predicting solar storms, which are inherently spatio-temporal events, and uses deep learning for this purpose.

results.title: Seeing Clearly, Forgetting Deeply: Revisiting Fine-Tuned Video Generators for Driving Simulation
results.summary: This work investigates the effects of fine-tuning video generation approaches on structured driving datasets. It uncovers a potential trade-off where visual fidelity improves but spatial accuracy in modeling dynamic scenes may be compromised.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses video generation for driving simulation, which inherently involves spatio-temporal data and modeling. The summary mentions "spatial accuracy."

results.title: MuST2-Learn: Multi-view Spatial-Temporal-Type Learning for Heterogeneous Municipal Service Time Estimation
results.summary: This paper proposes MuST2-Learn, a multi-view spatial-temporal-type learning approach for estimating municipal service times. It aims to enhance transparency and resident satisfaction by providing better information on service request resolution.
results.usefulness_reason: The title explicitly includes "Spatial-Temporal-Type Learning," indicating a direct and substantial focus on spatio-temporal aspects.

results.title: Transcranial Photoacoustic Imaging for Human Intracranial Pressure Evaluation
results.summary: This study proposes a multi-wavelength photoacoustic tomography system and method for intracranial pressure assessment. It aims to overcome challenges in transcranial photoacoustic imaging due to signal attenuation by the skull.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper is about medical imaging, which involves spatial data, but the summary does not explicitly mention a strong spatio-temporal focus or modeling.

results.title: Domain-aligned generative downscaling enhances projections of extreme climate events
results.summary: This study proposes a domain-aligned generative downscaling method to enhance projections of extreme climate events. It addresses limitations of global climate models in simulating such events due to insufficient resolution and high computational costs.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper focuses on projecting extreme climate events, which are inherently spatio-temporal phenomena, and uses generative downscaling, implying spatio-temporal modeling.

results.title: Benchmarking Training Paradigms, Dataset Composition, and Model Scaling for Child ASR in ESPnet
results.summary: This paper benchmarks training paradigms, dataset composition, and model scaling for child ASR. It compares flat-start training across multiple datasets and SSL representations, showing SSL representations are biased toward adult speech.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses "dataset composition" and "limited annotated data," which is relevant to the concept of datasets, but not specifically "contextual datasets" as a primary focus.

results.title: A Disease-Centric Vision-Language Foundation Model for Precision Oncology in Kidney Cancer
results.summary: This study developed and validated RenalCLIP, a visual-language foundation model for characterizing, diagnosing, and prognosticating renal masses. It used a large dataset of CT scans from multiple medical centers.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper uses a large dataset of CT scans, making it relevant to the term "dataset," but it doesn't primarily focus on the "contextual" aspect of the dataset.

results.title: Closer to Reality: Practical Semi-Supervised Federated Learning for Foundation Model Adaptation
results.summary: This paper addresses the adaptation of foundation models in privacy-sensitive applications using federated learning. It focuses on practical semi-supervised federated learning to overcome limitations of edge devices like computational resources and scarce labeled data.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses data privacy and edge data in the context of federated learning, which implies a focus on the contextual nature and constraints of datasets.

results.title: Spherical latent space models for social network analysis
results.summary: This article introduces a spherical latent space model for social network analysis, embedding actors on a hypersphere. This geometry facilitates the representation of transitive relationships and community structure, mitigating degeneracy issues.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper focuses on social network analysis, where the data often has inherent contextual relationships, making it relevant to "contextual dataset."

results.title: TinyML Towards Industry 4.0: Resource-Efficient Process Monitoring of a Milling Machine
results.summary: This work presents a complete TinyML flow for resource-efficient process monitoring of a milling machine in Industry 4.0. It covers dataset generation, machine learning model development, and implementation on a microcontroller.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses "dataset generation" for process monitoring, which is relevant to datasets, but not primarily focused on the "contextual" aspect.

results.title: LLM-Based Agents for Competitive Landscape Mapping in Drug Asset Due Diligence
results.summary: This paper describes a competitor-discovery component within an agentic AI system for drug asset due diligence. The AI agent retrieves and extracts attributes for drugs in a competitive landscape, handling fragmented and ontology-mismatched data.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses various data sources for drug asset due diligence, but "survey data" is not explicitly mentioned or a primary focus.

results.title: Leveraging national forest inventory data to estimate forest carbon density status and trends for small areas
results.summary: This paper explores leveraging national forest inventory (NFI) data to estimate forest carbon density status and trends, particularly for small spatial, temporal, or biophysical domains where traditional design-based estimators are unreliable due to sparse data. It addresses the challenges of using survey data for small area estimation.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper is relevant as it explicitly mentions "spatial, temporal" domains and utilizes "survey data" (National Forest Inventory data). However, it does not directly focus on "Point Process" or "Contextual dataset" as core methodologies or topics, making it more of an application paper rather than a foundational one for those specific areas. Thus, a score of 70 is assigned.

results.title: Accelerating Historical K-Core Search in Temporal Graphs
results.summary: We study the temporal k-core component search (TCCS), which outputs the k-core containing the query vertex in the snapshot over an arbitrary query time window in a temporal graph. The problem has been shown to be critical for tasks such as contact tracing, fault diagnosis, and financial forensics. The state-of-the-art EF-Index designs a separated forest structure for a set of carefully selected windows, incurring quadratic preprocessing time and large redundant storage. Our method introduces the
results.usefulness_reason: The title explicitly mentions 'Temporal Graphs' and the summary discusses 'temporal k-core component search' and 'query time window,' which are directly relevant to the 'Spatio Temporal' aspect of the query, even if it doesn't explicitly use the phrase 'spatio-temporal.' The concept of a temporal graph implies a spatio-temporal structure.

results.title: First-Order LTLf Synthesis with Lookback (Extended Version)
results.summary: Reactive synthesis addresses the problem of generating a controller for a temporal specification in an adversarial environment; it was typically studied for LTL. Driven by applications ranging from AI to business process management, LTLf modulo first order-theories over finite traces (LTLfMT) has recently gained traction, where propositional variables in properties are replaced by first-order constraints. Though reactive synthesis for LTLf with some first-order features has been addressed, existi
results.usefulness_reason: The summary mentions 'temporal specification' and 'LTLf' which are related to temporal logic and reasoning over time. While not explicitly 'spatio-temporal,' the temporal aspect is present and relevant.

results.title: Frozen in Time: Parameter-Efficient Time Series Transformers via Reservoir-Induced Feature Expansion and Fixed Random Dynamics
results.summary: Transformers are the de-facto choice for sequence modelling, yet their quadratic self-attention and weak temporal bias can make long-range forecasting both expensive and brittle. We introduce FreezeTST, a lightweight hybrid that interleaves frozen random-feature (reservoir) blocks with standard trainable Transformer layers. The frozen blocks endow the network with rich nonlinear memory at no optimisation cost; the trainable layers learn to query this memory through self-attention. The design cut
results.usefulness_reason: The title and summary explicitly mention 'Time Series' and 'long-range forecasting,' which are directly related to the temporal aspect of 'Spatio Temporal.'

results.title: Caregiver-in-the-Loop AI: A Simulation-Based Feasibility Study for Dementia Task Verification
results.summary: This feasibility study evaluates an AI-powered task verification system for caregivers of people living with dementia. It examines GPT-4's ability to generate effective follow-up questions and the accuracy of AI-driven task verification, highlighting the use of contextual information.
results.usefulness_reason: The system implicitly uses contextual information for task verification, making it relevant to the application of contextual data, even if not directly about dataset creation or analysis methods.

results.title: MMTok: Multimodal Coverage Maximization for Efficient Inference of VLMs
results.summary: This paper introduces MMTok, a method to improve the inference efficiency of Vision-Language Models (VLMs) by reducing redundant vision tokens. It leverages multimodal information for pruning, addressing the challenge of efficient processing of contextual multimodal data.
results.usefulness_reason: Discusses multimodal information, which is a form of contextual data, in the context of Vision-Language Models, making it relevant to how contextual data is processed and used.

results.title: Scene-Agnostic Traversability Labeling and Estimation via a Multimodal Self-supervised Framework
results.summary: This paper proposes a multimodal self-supervised framework for traversability estimation in robots. It integrates heterogeneous sensory modalities to capture characteristics of non-traversable regions, addressing limitations of single-modality approaches and leveraging contextual information.
results.usefulness_reason: Utilizes multimodal sensory data to provide context for traversability estimation, directly relating to the application and use of contextual datasets.

results.title: Addressing Dipole Tension via Clustering in $Î›$CDM and beyond
results.summary: This work investigates the dipole in the angular distribution of the cosmic microwave background (CMB) and large-scale structures. It uses observational data, which can be considered survey data in astrophysics, to address discrepancies with predictions based on the CMB.
results.usefulness_reason: Uses observational data, which can be considered a form of survey data in astrophysics, making it relevant to the application of survey data, although the primary focus is cosmology.

results.title: Fast approximate Bayesian inference of HIV indicators using PCA adaptive Gauss-Hermite quadrature
results.summary: Naomi is a spatial evidence synthesis model used to produce district-level HIV epidemic indicators in sub-Saharan Africa. Multiple outcomes of policy interest, including HIV prevalence, HIV incidence, and antiretroviral therapy treatment coverage are jointly modelled using both household survey data and routinely reported health system data.
results.usefulness_reason: The paper discusses a "spatial evidence synthesis model" and utilizes "household survey data" to model HIV indicators, which can be considered a contextual dataset. While it doesn't explicitly mention "Spatio Temporal Point Process", the spatial modeling and use of survey data make it relevant to the broader topic.
